taxonomicnotes: Originally described as Noemacheilus arunachalensis (Datta and Barman 1984) from Namdapha River, Namdapha Wildlife Sanctuary, Tirap District, Arunachal Pradesh, India, the species is currently placed in the genus Lepidocephalichthys.
rationale: Lepidocephalichthys arunachalensis is recorded from India (Namdapha National Park, Tirap district (Arunachal Pradesh). A recent extensive survey of Arunachal Pradesh did not report the species (Bagra et al. 2009), and other surveys in the area have also not reported the species (Tamang et al. 2007). The AOO is estimated at under 500 km2, and the extent of occurrence is inferred to be less than 2,000 km2 based on the extent of suitable habitat within the protected area.  There is extensive deforestation and logging activities within the type locality leading to sedimentation which will impact the species. The type locality is in a National Park, but the effectiveness of protection is uncertain.  Whilst the species is recorded from a protected area, there is clear evidence of threats in the surrounding area, including siltation caused by deforestation, which will directly impact the habitat of the species. Based on the available information on restricted distribution and threats to the habitat, this species is assessed as Endangered.  However, recent surveys in the type locality and surrounding areas has not yielded this species (Tamang et al. 2007, Bagra et al. 2009), which could mean that the species may potentially be extinct.  It therefore requires further studies to establish its current status.
evaluator: Daniel, B.A., Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M., Allen, D.J. & Molur, S.
